question: What causes Ocular Thelaziasis?
ideal_answer: Ocular Thelaziasis is caused by Thelazia callipaeda.

snippets.text: Human ocular thelaziasis caused by gravid Thelazia callipaeda - A unique and rare case report.

We report the first case of human ocular thelaziasis in Nepal in a 6-month-old child from a Rukum district, Nepal. The infant presented with conjunctivitis, and his visual acuity and dilated fundal examination were normal. A total of 6 worms were removed for identification. Collected nematodes were identified based on morphological keys as Thelazia callipaeda.
Thelaziasis is an arthropod-born disease of the eye and adnexa caused by Thelazia callipaeda, a nematode parasite transmitted by drosophilid flies to carnivores and humans.
Thelaziasis is an arthropod-born disease of the eye and adnexa caused by Thelazia callipaeda, a nematode parasite transmitted by drosophilid flies to carnivores and humans.
BACKGROUND: Thelazia callipaeda is the main causative organism in thelaziasis, commonly infecting orbital cavities and associated tissues of carnivores.

Thelaziasis is a zoonosis caused by
nematodes of the genus Thelazia, parasites of the conjunctival bags or tear ducts of mammals and birds.

Thelaziasis is an ocular infection of several mammals caused by nematodes of the genus Thelazia (Spirurida, Thelaziidae).
Human thelaziasis is a zoonotic eye disease caused by a nematode parasite called Thelazia
Thelaziasis is an ocular arthropod-borne, zoonotic disease of the eye infecting the conjunctival sac, lacrimal duct, and lacrimal gland caused by a nematode of the genus Thelazia.
